definition: to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: It actually took all my luck to meet you for just a moment in my lifetime.
sentences.chinese: 在有生旳瞬间遇见你，竟花光全部运气。

sentences.english: You've the only person that Imet here.
sentences.chinese: 你是我在这儿遇见的唯一的一个人。

sentences.english: Nice to meet you, Han Mei.
Would we meet any in this colossal ocean?
sentences.chinese: 我们会在浩瀚的大海上遇见什么人吗？

sentences.english: I haven’t met Wang Ying since last year.
sentences.chinese: 自去年以来我就未遇见过王英。

sentences.english: I ran into one of my classmates last weekend at Warner Village.
sentences.chinese: 我上周末在华纳威秀遇见我的一个同学。

sentences.english: A bit further down the street, Pam bumps into an old friend, Susie.
sentences.chinese: 潘再走了一段路后遇见老朋友苏西。

sentences.english: Hi, Bob. Fancy meeting you like this.
sentences.chinese: 嗨，鲍勃，没想到在这遇见你。

sentences.english: Continue pushing foward and success will eventually meet you.
sentences.chinese: 继续前进，你最终会遇见成功。

sentences.english: When we had this crisis we didn't know what was happening. We didn't have research on it.
sentences.chinese: 我们遇见危机时还不知道啥事呢，因为没有研究。

sentences.english: Right now I feel like Romeo when he first saw Julieta.
sentences.chinese: 眼前，我有了罗密欧初次遇见朱丽叶的那种感觉。

sentences.english: Coincidentally, Li Fuxiu and Chen Zhongqiang met literature Ning, also from the chase after.
sentences.chinese: 事有凑巧，李复修及陈忠强遇见文学宁，亦从后追去。

sentences.english: The revenger of blood himself shall slay the murderer: when he meeteth him, he shall slay him.
sentences.chinese: 报血仇的必亲自杀那故杀人的，一遇见就杀他。

sentences.english: And wha met ye there, my handsome young man?
sentences.chinese: 你遇见了什么，我俊俏的年轻人？

sentences.english: We meet a clarinet and a flute.

definition: to meet by chance/to run into sb/chance encounter
to meet/to run into/to come across
meet by chance/have a chance encounter
to accompany sb/to accompany each other
fate or chance that brings people together/predestined affinity or relationship/(Budd.) destiny
to fall in love with/to be in love with
to see each other/to meet in person
